DataElement.preferredDefinition: a yes/no question related to a person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary being able to give permission.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to a person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary being able to give permission.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Permission to do something.:The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

DataElementConcept.origin: NCCTG CRF:North Central Cancer Treatment Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.description: Capable of providing informed consent

ReferenceDocuments.name: Ability to provide informed w
ReferenceDocuments.description: Ability to provide informed written consent

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text3
ReferenceDocuments.description: Provide informed written consent

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have the ability to understand the written informed consent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CRF Text 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Ability to understand and willingness to sign a written informed consent document

ReferenceDocuments.name: PBTC_Text1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have the ability to understand and the willingness to sign a written informed consent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: CITN
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patient must sign a written informed consent document.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Ability to understand an informed consent document
ReferenceDocuments.description: Ability to understand an informed consent document (even if only verbally) and willingness to sign a written informed consent document

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF1804_consent
ReferenceDocuments.description: Ability to understand and the willingness to sign a written informed consent document.

ReferenceDocuments.name: AMC Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the participant have the ability to understand and the willingness to provide informed consent?

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF1804 v2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Able to understand and willing to provide verbal informed consent

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1603 Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient able to provide a written informed consent or a remote consent if accepted per institutional requirements and approved by reviewing IRB?

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF 1802 v2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Ability to understand an informed consent document (even if only verbally) and willingness to agree to informed consent

ReferenceDocuments.name: Be able to provide written informed consent.
ReferenceDocuments.description: Be able to provide written informed consent.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Be willing and able to provide informed consent and must sign consent in-person or remotely if it is not convenient or feasible to provide informed consent in-person
ReferenceDocuments.description: Be willing and able to provide informed consent and must sign consent in-person or remotely if it is not convenient or feasible to provide informed consent in-person

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_eCRF_Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have the ability to understand and the willingness to sign an IRB approved written informed consent document (or that of legally authorized representative, if applicable)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Have a condition that precludes their ability to participate in informed consent or procedures
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have a condition that precludes their ability to participate in informed consent or procedures (e.g., dementia and/or Blessed Orientation Memory Concentration (BOMC) Score >11).

ReferenceDocuments.name: URCC21038
ReferenceDocuments.description: Be able to provide written or remote informed consent

ReferenceDocuments.name: WF-1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Patients must be able to provide informed consent.

ReferenceDocuments.name: URCC22053
ReferenceDocuments.description: Be able to provide written informed consent.

ReferenceDocuments.name: URCC19178
ReferenceDocuments.description: Have a condition that precludes their ability to participate in informed consent or procedures (e.g., dementia).
